result.execSummary:
The defendant James R Helm Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James R Helm Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James R Helm Jr was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • James R Helm Jr was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by Attorney Brent Varner
filed by Attorney Brent Varner

Cases called: 15CF243, 16CM134, 15CM166 & 15CF255, Defendant James R Helm in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victims were notified of today's hearing. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1,2,5 in 15CF243, cts. 3&4 in 15CM166, ct. 3 in 15CF255. Factual bases established. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgments. Sentencing statements by Attys. Varner & Cross. Defendant made a statement. In 15CF243 on ct. 1, Court imposed 6 months jail, start 6/17/16 at 7 p.m. Huber granted. $343 costs, on ct. 2, $243 costs imposed, on ct. 5, sentence withheld, 4 yr. probation, conds: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete anger management and domestic abuse counseling. Submit DNA sample. $518 costs. Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages. (6 days jail credit on ct. 1).  In 15CF255, 4 yr. probation, conds: $518 costs. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages. (4 days jail credit)  In 15CM166 on cts. 3&4, Court withheld sentence, 2 yr. probation, conds: $443 & $243 costs. Complete anger management counseling. No contact with D.H. $130.40 restitution on ct. 4. (3 days jail credit) Posted bonds applied to costs. Court dismissed all other counts not pled to. 16CM134 dismissed. Called 1:10 p.m. Adjourned 1:46 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant James R Helm in court with attorney Brent W. Varner.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CF255, 15CF243 and 15CM166.  In both felony cases, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived.  In all cases defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
